ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course gives a comprehensive structure of the digital age which is no small feat. Likewise this course gives an overview of a handful of useful algorithms and a framework for understanding them in the future.
This class was a good overview of various effects of technology on society. I didn't feel I learned many specific skills, but it definitely informed how I think about technology and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was a lecture course with 6 people in it. However with no assignments and only two tests knowing how well one was understanding the material was very hard. I came to my own understanding and can speak at length on the subject but am not sure My understanding matched the immense amount of knowledge i could have gotten from the class.

Strength: Interesting material, not overly complicated. Generally pretty easy to follow Weakness: Reading was much more technical than lecture/test. Having many technical papers assigned each week discouraged me from doing the reading

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's very little work until the final, but it's pretty boring at times.
This course is one of those where you get the most out of it by engaging with the material. If you want to thing on a grand scale about the digital age then you should shop this class and see.
This is a good course for someone wanting a SOCY credit. It is not particularly difficult, and also pretty interesting.
